timeline.bodyText: Can we use the new ProcessEngineRule(PROCESS_ENGINE_CONFIG) here? I have the impression that this could remove the initialization from this test class.
timeline.author: tmetzke

replies.bodyText: I decided not to use it because the logging rule wouldn't work. The log is written on bootstrap level and can therefore not be captured if bootstrapping is not part of the test.
replies.author: tasso94

timeline.bodyText: Is this necessary in order to test what the test case title indicates? Should this rather be part of a second test case 'shouldUseConfiguredInvocationsForBatchType'?
timeline.author: tmetzke

replies.bodyText:
What we already cover by other tests:

invocations by specific batch type
global configuration (by older test cases already present in the code base)

However, I think it makes sense to have a scenario in which we assert that a mixed configuration works as expected. I'm open for proposals how to rename this test case.
replies.author: tasso94

replies.bodyText:
I totally agree with all points. 👍
Leaves the question: is it technically necessary to start a process instance here and such, or is it enough to simply create the second batch and assert its configuration?
replies.author: tmetzke

replies.bodyText:
The creation of this batch type would fail if no process instance is available [1]
[1] https://github.com/camunda/camunda-bpm-platform/blob/master/engine/src/main/java/org/camunda/bpm/engine/impl/cmd/batch/DeleteProcessInstanceBatchCmd.java#L73
replies.author: tasso94

replies.bodyText:
OK, I see, thanks for the clarification!
The test case title is fine then as well. 👍
